sequencealgorithms

Class AlignmentMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • sequencealgorithms.AlignmentMatrix

  • public class AlignmentMatrix
extends Object
    ScoringMatrix is a n x m matrix which keeps track of the alignment scores.
    Author:
    riha

    • Constructor Detail

      • AlignmentMatrix

        public AlignmentMatrix(int m,
               int n)
        Constructor for the AlignmentMatrix.
        Parameters:
        m - The length of the first sequence to be aligned.
        n - The length of the second sequence to be aligned.

    • Method Detail

      • setScore

        public void setScore(int m,
            int n,
            double score)
        Sets the alignment score for a single entry. Also updates the best score and its coordinates if necessary.
        Parameters:
        m - The first coordinate of the entry.
        n - The second coordinate of the entry.
        score - The alignment score to be set.

      • setPath

        public void setPath(int m,
           int n,
           int previous)
        Sets the path score for a single entry.
        Parameters:
        m - The first coordinate of the entry.
        n - The second coordinate of the entry.
        previous - The int code of the direction to be set (0 = diagonal, 1 = vertical, 2 = horizontal)

        public int getPath(int m,
          int n)
        Returns a path from where the computation arrived to this entry.
        Parameters:
        m -
        n -
        Returns:
        An integer of following coding: 0 - diagonal 1 - vertical 2 - horizontal
